intro: Specularia conferta, commonly known as the clustered fairybells, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often forming dense clusters at the base of the plant. Specularia conferta is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
